messages.subject: Re: Mei translation help requested
messages.msgSnippet: No Sweat. By the way, your Japanese reading ability is incredibly good. It is very hard to read proper names even for us Japanese. If I can be of any help to
messages.messageBody:
No Sweat.

By the way, your Japanese reading ability is incredibly good.
It is very hard to read proper names even for us Japanese.

If I can be of any help to you, I am more than glad.

messages.subject: RE: [nihontostudy] Re: Mei translation help requested
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks for the help! Take care, Jim ... From: incu903 [mailto:zaigo21@bp.iij4u.or.jp] Sent: Sunday, August 22, 2004 4:54 PM To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
messages.messageBody:
Thanks for the help!

Take care,
Jim


-----Original Message-----
From: incu903 [mailto:zaigo21@...]
Sent: Sunday, August 22, 2004 4:54 PM
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [nihontostudy] Re: Mei translation help requested


I am a Japanese living in Japan.

It's Kanazawa, not Kanezawa

Kashu is another name of Kaga.
Kaga is the old name (Edo period) for the region where Kanazawa belongs.
Now, Kanazawa belongs to Ishikawa prefecture.

For Kanetoyo, I do not know the details
but this is not the first time I see his name.

messages.messageBody:
I am a Japanese living in Japan.

It's Kanazawa, not Kanezawa

Kashu is another name of Kaga.
Kaga is the old name (Edo period) for the region where Kanazawa belongs.
Now, Kanazawa belongs to Ishikawa prefecture.

For Kanetoyo, I do not know the details
but this is not the first time I see his name.

messages.subject: Mei translation help requested
messages.msgSnippet: A visitor to my website sent me this file for translation: http://home.comcast.net/~tantojim/mei.jpg It looks to me to read: Kashu Kanezawa (no) ju Kanetoyo
messages.messageBody:
A visitor to my website sent me this file for translation:



http://home.comcast.net/~tantojim/mei.jpg



It looks to me to read:



Kashu Kanezawa (no) ju Kanetoyo Saku Kore



I don't see this smith listed in the Nihonto Meikan. Can someone shed light
on either the reading or this smith?



Thanks,

Jim



_____________________________________________________

BladeShark



* Kanji character tables
* http://bladeshark.com/
* email: tantojim@...







[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
